function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"The use of IoT, drones, robots, and wearable devices can lead to privacy and data security risks, as personal health information may be compromised.","Impact":"Violation of personal privacy, potential for identity theft, and exposure of sensitive health data.","Mitigation":"Implement strong encryption and data security measures, ensure compliance with data protection regulations, and provide clear guidelines for data access and usage.","Technologies":"Encryption, blockchain, secure data storage and transmission.","People":"Patients, healthcare professionals, individuals wearing wearable devices.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, technology companies, regulatory authorities."},{"Description":"Reliance on cloud computing and big data analytics for outbreak prediction and tracking may lead to data breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive information.","Impact":"Compromised data integrity, privacy violations, and misuse of personal health data.","Mitigation":"Implement robust access controls, data encryption, and secure authentication measures, and conduct regular security audits and compliance checks.","Technologies":"Data encryption, access controls, secure authentication, security audits.","People":"Patients, healthcare professionals, individuals whose data is being analyzed.","Owner":"Cloud service providers, data analytics firms, healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"Deployment of AI and ML for disease prediction and diagnosis may lead to biases in decision-making and inaccurate assessments, impacting treatment and resource allocation.","Impact":"Increased risk of misdiagnosis, unequal treatment based on demographic factors, and inefficiencies in healthcare delivery.","Mitigation":"Regular assessment of algorithm biases, diversification of training data, and transparency in AI decision-making processes.","Technologies":"Algorithm bias assessment tools, diversified training datasets, transparency frameworks for AI decision-making.","People":"Patients, healthcare professionals, individuals in vulnerable demographics.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, AI and ML developers, regulatory authorities."}]}
